meanings.definition: An address or communication emphatically urging someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach's exhortation to never give up inspired the team to keep pushing forward.
meanings.sent2: She received an exhortation from her mentor to always strive for excellence.
meanings.sent3: The exhortation to eat more vegetables was met with laughter by the picky eater.
meanings.sent4: His exhortation to climb the mountain of success resonated with the ambitious students.
meanings.sent5: The exhortation to be kind to others echoed in her mind long after the speech.

meanings.definition: The act or process of urging someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The exhortation of the crowd motivated him to run faster in the race.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, there was a constant exhortation for everyone to participate actively.
meanings.sent3: The exhortation to clean up their room led to a playful pillow fight instead.
meanings.sent4: Her exhortation to follow their dreams was like a gentle push towards success.
meanings.sent5: The exhortation to study hard was emphasized by the teacher before the exam.
